abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Cambodia Road
            Rehabilitation Project were as follows: outcomes were
            moderately satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was
            substantial, the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the
            Borrower performance was also moderately satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned included: a well designed project that is
            adjusted to the capacity of the Borrower, both financially
            and institutionally is essential for its success;
            integrating project activities into the Ministry is needed
            to promote ownership; and to move from post-conflict
            interventions towards long term planning horizon requires
            appropriate and gradual engagement.

repnme.cdata!:
Cambodia - Road Rehabilitation Project :
            resettlement action plan

abstracts.cdata!:
The Road Rehabilitation Project involves
            the rehabilitation and reconstruction of roads in three
            regions - Sihanoukville Municipality, Phnom Penh
            Municipality, and Siem Reap. This Resettlement Action Plan
            (RAP) is a guide to define which households will be
            negatively affected by the project, where they are located,
            what compensation measures are to be provided, and how and
            when these measures must be implemented. A Cambodian
            nongovernmental organization (NGO) undertook a survey and
            found out that about 1818 households would be affected by
            the project and eligible for compensation, and that almost
            700 structures would have to be removed during the project.
            Compensation available are: compensation for loss of land
            and assets; compensation for temporary loss of livelihood;
            compensation for loss of community structures/facilities;
            and a flat shifting allowance. Monitoring of RAP
            implementation will be conducted by an external auditor (NGO
            or consultant) periodically.

repnme.cdata!:
Cambodia - Road Rehabilitation Project :
            initial environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
The Road Rehabilitation Project entails
            the upgrading of 115.2km of roads in Phnom Penh
            Municipality, Sihanoukville Municipality, and Siem Reap
            Province. This Initial Environmental Assessment aims to
            identify the impacts of the project activities.
            Environmental impacts in Phnom Penh Municipality are
            negligible. In Sihanoukville Town and Siem Reap Province,
            replanting program will take place during construction to
            avoid erosion of the new fill slopes and increased siltation
            of local waterways. All culverts will have sufficient
            capacity to carry the runoff flows without constricting
            channels and increasing flow speeds so that new erosion or
            fish migration problems will not arise. During construction,
            the impact of dust will be mitigated by spraying water onto
            dry materials. Vehicles delivering materials to and from the
            construction sites should be covered. To reduce air and
            noise pollution, vehicles and machinery will be regularly
            maintained. Trees planted along the roadsides and in
            villages to replace the ones lost during construction will
            have a tending and maintenance schedule prepard and
            live-tree counts provided to the authorities concerned every
            six months.
